name: The Continent
description: The Continent is a vast, war‑torn land of fog‑shrouded forests, rolling plains, and crumbling cities. Magic and monsters linger in every corner, while humans, elves, dwarves, and other races vie for power. The Wild Hunt rides the skies, hunting Geralt of Rivia across a tapestry of political intrigue and ancient lore. Dark fairy tales and brutal reality blend, creating a world both beautiful and unforgiving.

White Orchard.name: White Orchard
White Orchard.description: White Orchard is a small, forested valley on the edge of Temeria, known for its rolling hills and quiet streams. It is dotted with farms, a modest inn, and a ruined keep that serve as the starting point for many travelers. The area is populated by local peasants, itinerant merchants, and a few stray monsters such as wolves and drowners. A small garrison of Temerian soldiers occasionally patrols the roads.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: He is a tall, scarred witcher with white hair and pale, cat‑like eyes. His skin bears the muted gray of countless monster battles, and his armor is a mix of leather and steel. He works as a monster slayer for hire, wielding two swords—one steel, one silver. In White Orchard, he seeks the missing witcher Vesemir’s former apprentice and hunts the griffin terrorising the village. His purpose is to investigate rumors of a hidden Cerys tower and to test a new potion for enhanced senses.

Royal Palace in Vizima.name: Royal Palace in Vizima
Royal Palace in Vizima.description: The Royal Palace sits in the heart of Vizima, the capital of Temeria, and dominates the city with its towering walls and grand courtyards. Inside, nobles, councilors, and the king's guard manage political affairs while scholars and mages maintain the library and alchemy labs. The surrounding market is filled with merchants, craftsmen, and street performers. Guarded by elite soldiers, the palace also houses imprisoned war criminals and a hidden network of spies.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt stands tall in his worn, silver‑haired cloak, his pale skin and scarred visage marked by countless battles. He wears his signature twin swords at his hips, the steel glinting even in Vizima’s dim corridors. As a witcher, he travels the land hunting monsters and negotiating political intrigue. He is in the Royal Palace to investigate rumors of a cursed noble and to protect the kingdom from a hidden threat.

Velen.name: Velen
Velen.description: Velen, also called the No Man's Land, is a scarred plain of swamps, ruined farms, and war‑torn villages under perpetual mist. Its people are mostly peasants, afflicted by famine and bandit raids, along with scattered soldiers from the Northern Kingdoms. The region is controlled by the ruthless warlord Stregobor's followers, the Crones of Crookback Bog, and the loosely organized Scoia’tael rebels. Dangerous creatures like leshens, drowners, and wraiths roam the marshes, making travel hazardous.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt is a tall, scarred witcher with white hair and amber eyes, his armor bears the Wolf School insignia. He is a professional monster hunter hired to track and slay dangerous creatures. He has traveled to Velen to investigate a surge of restless specters and a cursed village, seeking both a reward and clues about the Wild Hunt.

Novigrad.name: Novigrad
Novigrad.description: Novigrad is a bustling free port city built on the banks of the Pontar River, famed for its towering cathedral, vibrant bazaars, and dark alleys. Citizens include merchants, artisans, scholars, and a large population of refugees and outcasts. Powerful factions such as the Church of the Eternal Fire, the criminal syndicate of the Rats, and the secretive Lodge of Sorceresses vie for influence. The city is also home to guilds of mages, thieves, and a constant presence of street guards and hired mercenaries.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt stands tall, his white hair pulled back, and his yellow eyes scan the city's alleys. He wears his familiar leather armor, a silver sword at his hip and a steel blade strapped to his back. As a witcher, he travels the streets hunting monsters and seeking contracts. In Novigrad he searches for information about Ciri and the mysterious Wild Hunt.

The Skellige Isles.name: The Skellige Isles
The Skellige Isles.description: The Skellige Isles are a rugged archipelago of storm‑ battered cliffs, pine forests, and windswept villages that value strength and seafaring skill. Inhabitants are fierce islanders, clan chiefs, and seasoned sailors who follow ancient codes of honor. The major clans—Hjalmar, Irden, and others—compete for territory, while druids and skalds preserve old myths and rites. A strong navy of warships patrols the seas, and the local taverns echo with the tales of warriors and the songs of bards.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt is a tall, white‑haired witcher with scarred skin and amber eyes. He wears weather‑worn leather armor and a silver sword at his hip. His profession is a monster hunter and a trained witcher of the School of the Wolf. He has come to the Skellige Isles to investigate a surge of sea‑creature attacks and to seek a contract from the local jarls. He also hopes to find clues about Ciri’s whereabouts.

Kaer Morhen.name: Kaer Morhen
Kaer Morhen.description: Kaer Morhen is an ancient, snow‑capped keep high in the Blue Mountains, serving as the witchers' training ground and sanctuary. It is inhabited by a handful of surviving witchers, their mentors, and a few loyal caretakers. The walls protect hidden armories, alchemy labs, and a library of monster lore. Despite its isolation, occasional visitors like scholars, merchants, or desperate fugitives seek refuge within its stone halls.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt stands tall with white hair tied back, a scarred face, and piercing yellow eyes. He is a witcher, a monster hunter trained at Kaer Morhen. He has returned to the fortress to recuperate, train new apprentices, and ready himself for the upcoming threats. His purpose is to gather intelligence on the Wild Hunt and forge alliances for the battles ahead.

start: I am Geralt of Rivia, a scar‑marked witcher of the Wolf School, hair white as winter snow and eyes that see what others cannot. I am standing in White Orchard, a quiet valley of rolling hills, a meandering stream, a modest inn, and the crumbling keep that marks the edge of Temeria. I see nervous peasants pointing to the sky where a griffin circles, a trail of torn feathers across the fields, and a thin line of Temerian soldiers keeping watch along the road.
